'''Optical Headbands''' are [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]] [[Category:XC3FR Accessories]]

[[File:Zafa Ories.jpg|thumb|Zafa Ories]] '''Ories''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|オリエス}}, ''Oriesu'') are a horned family of quadrupedal enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They are very similar to [[Balgas]], and live in cold regions. They undergo no appearance change between games, and all look identical.
'''[[Aries]]''': There are very few differences between an Aries and an Ories. It is assumed that Ories are male and Aries are female and that this is the only reason for their name differences.
== {{XC|-}} == In {{XC}}, Ories are found only on [[Valak Mountain]]. Most Ories resemble bulls or yaks, although two species sport antlers instead of horns, which makes them appear more like bulky deer or elk. There are two types of Ories.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Zefa Ories]] * [[Zegia Ories]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Agile Barbatos]]
== {{XC2|-}} == In {{XC2}}, only one Ories type appears, being found in the [[Kingdom of Tantal]].
=== Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Novl Ories]]
== {{XC3|-}} == In {{XC3}}, Ories are only found on [[Captocorn Peak]].
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Karorii Ories]] * [[Mant Ories]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Spiralhorn Baccro]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Mant Ories]]

[[City]] }} '''Orson''' is an NPC and in {{XC3}} who can be found in [[Colony 15]], and later in the [[City]]. {{clr}} == Battle == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Orson |image = |caption = Orson |category = [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |type = [[Keves Forces]] |level = 48 |area = [[Erythia Sea]] ([[Colony 15]]) |spawntime = During ''[[Doing It My Way]]'' |respawn = No |movement = |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = |gold = |hp = |strength = |healing = |dexterity = |agility = |physdef = |ethdef = |critrate = |guardrate-front = |guardrate-side = |guardrate-back = }} '''Orson''' is a [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] in {{XC3}}. He is a [[Keves Forces|Keves Soldier]] who is fought at level 48 in [[Colony 15]] in [[Erythia Sea]] during ''[[Doing It My Way]]''. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:Cadensia Region NPCs]] [[Category:XC3 Kevesi]] [[Category:City NPCs]] [[Category:XC3 Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Exclusive Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Enemies]] [[Category:Cadensia Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Keves Forces]] [[Category:XC3 Level 46-50 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing an infobox image]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]] [[Category:XC3 NPCs missing info]]

[[File:XC3 Tikhta Ottil.jpg|thumb|Tikhta Ottil]] '''Ottils''' are a family of otter-like enemies in {{XC3}}.

{{spoiler}} {{Infobox Mechanic |name = Ouroboros |image = Ouroborus.png |caption = |purpose = |appearances = {{XC3}}
{{XC3FR|sublink}} |other = |related = [[Interlink]] }} '''Ouroboros''' (Japanese: {{Lang|jp|ウロボロス}}, ''Uroborosu'') are characters in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. == Overview == Ouroboros are people who can fight against [[Moebius]]. Up to six people can be Ouroboros at a time. Ouroboros have the ability to [[Interlink]], where two Ouroboros combine to use powerful forms. Each Ouroboros has its own powerful moveset, and deciding when to transform can be the key to winning a battle. [[Noah]], [[Mio]], [[Eunie]], [[Taion]], [[Lanz]], and [[Sena]] are the current six Ouroboros. Noah and Mio, Eunie and Taion, and Lanz and Sena are the pairs that can Interlink. [[File:Ouroboros – Xenoblade Chronicles 3|thumb|240px|center|Ouroboros]] == Story == After escaping [[Z]] and the other [[Moebius]], [[Nia]] used the little energy from [[Origin]] she still had access to alongside her own [[Core Crystal]] to create the [[Ouroboros Stone]]s, which provide the ability to Interlink to a maximum of six people. The [[Lost Numbers]] and the people of the [[City]] are descendants of the first Ouroboros, whose statues can be found there. Noah, Lanz and Eunie confront Mio, Taion and Sena in [[Alfeto Valley]], the two groups being selected for a special mission for [[Keves]] and [[Agnus]]. They meet during the course of those missions and clash on the battlefield until they are suddenly attacked by a [[Mysterious Enemy]], who is in fact the Interlinked form of the Consuls [[D]] and [[Joran|J]]. While Noah is trying to save Mio who is about to be attacked by the Giant, [[Guernica Vandham]] appears and activates an Ouroboros Stone that make their bodies fuse and transform into an Ouroboros. They manage to survive the attack of the Mysterious Enemy, however this leads to the six characters becoming the target of Keves and Agnus, now that they are fugitives and have the ability to transform into Ouroboros, considered by both nations as particularly dangerous beings. As a result of becoming Ouroboros, the party is freed from the control of the [[Flame Clock]]s. == Gameplay == {{main|Interlink}} At any time during battle, provided Interlinking is not sealed, if both characters of an Ouroboros pair are active (i.e. not incapacitated), they can perform an Interlink, combining the two characters into their larger, Ouroboros form. The Kevesi Ouroboros forms are unlocked at the end of Chapter 2, whereas the Agnian Ouroboros forms are unlocked at the end of Chapter 3. In this form, the pair of party members will use a different set of arts known as [[Battle Arts (XC3)#Ouroboros Arts|Ouroboros Arts]]. The regular Ouroboros Arts have no cooldown, but cannot be used twice in a row (meaning some other Art must be used before a particular Art can be used again). The Ouroboros form has no HP stat and thus cannot be incapacitated by damage, though both members can be incapacitated if the form moves out of bounds. When Interlinking, the constituent characters' buffs and debuffs will be applied onto this form, and applied onto the two characters once the Interlink ceases. The characters' HP values will also be retained before and after an Interlink. The strength of the Ouroboros form depends on the Interlink level, which initially starts at level 0, but can increase to a maximum of level 3 through usage of [[Battle Arts (XC3)#Fusion Arts|Fusion Arts]].[https://twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1544217186348453888 @XenobladeJP], Twitter, published July 5, 2022. Once an Interlink ends, the Interlink level will reset to level 0. === Heat Gauge === {{main|Heat Gauge}} During an Interlink, the [[Heat Gauge]] will slowly increase over time,[https://twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1544216895129546752 @XenobladeJP], Twitter, published July 5, 2022. and when Ouroboros Arts are canceled into each other (if unlocked). This gauge will drain slowly over time while characters are not Interlinked, but cannot be reduced in the Ouroboros form, meaning that characters can only stay Interlinked for a short period of time. If the Heat Gauge fills completely, the Ouroboros is said to have overheated, and the Interlink will automatically be canceled, reverting the two characters to their human form. Additionally, a cooldown will occur, preventing said characters from Interlinking until the Heat Gauge drains completely. This cooldown does not occur if the Interlink is released before overheating occurs. === Ouroboros Order === {{main|Chain Attack (XC3)#Ouroboros Orders}} When a [[Chain Attack (XC3)|Chain Attack]] is started, any ongoing Interlinks will be automatically released. However, Ouroboros forms can participate in Chain Attacks via '''Ouroboros Orders''', triggered if either the two characters belonging to an Ouroboros Order complete their orders, or if a Chain Attack is started while controlling an Ouroboros form with Interlink level 3. Once an Ouroboros Order is completed, the two characters will then Interlink and use their Ouroboros forms to attack the targeted enemy. === Soul Tree === {{main|Soul Tree}} Ouroboros can be further upgraded by spending Soul Points (abbreviated as SP) in the [[Soul Tree]] to unlock new traits and abilities. Soul Points are obtained by discovering [[Landmark]]s, opening [[Container]]s, and defeating [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monsters]]. Each party member has their own Soul Tree corresponding to their Ouroboros form. Once all Ouroboros forms are available, Soul Links are unlocked, allowing party members to take a Skill, Raise Ability upgrade, or Heat Gauge upgrade (but not Art) from their Ouroboros partner's Soul Tree. Initially, only one Soul Link slot is available, with the second slot unlocking upon completing that character's Side Story. == Etymology == An [[wikipedia:Ouroboros|Ouroboros]] is an ancient symbol depicting a serpent, dragon or worm that eats its own tail, as a representation of the continuous cycle of life and death, and by extension anything of a circular or recursive nature. The word comes from the Ancient Greek [[wiktionary:οὐροβόρος|οὐροβόρος]] meaning "tail-devouring". The symbol was adopted in [[wikipedia:Gnosticism|Gnosticism]] and [[wikipedia:Hermeticism|Hermeticism]] to symbolize the cycle of life, death, and rebirth. == Trivia == * Even though Moebius look like Ouroboros, they seem different as they are the result of the transformation of a Consul, and as Ouroboros are considered by both nations as particularly dangerous beings. * {{XC3|-}} director and producer Genki Yokota stated that Ouroboros originally looked more robotic earlier in the game's development.[https://www.nintendo.com/whatsnew/ask-the-developer-vol-6-xenoblade-chronicles-3-part-1/ Ask the Developer Vol. 6, Xenoblade Chronicles 3–Part 1], Nintendo, published July 26, 2022, retrieved July 26, 2022. ** This would make them even more like the ''[[w:c:xenosaga:Gear|gears]]'' from ''[[w:c:xenosaga:Xenogears|Xenogears]]'' than they already are in the final version. * In ''Xenogears'', Ouroboros, spelt as [[w:c:xenosaga:Urobolus|Urobolus]], is the final form of [[w:c:xenosaga:Myyah Hawwa|Myyah Hawwa]] and the final boss of the game. In ''[[w:c:xenosaga:Xenosaga|Xenosaga]]'', the Ouroboros symbol is the symbol of [[w:c:xenosaga:U.M.N.|Unus Mundus Network]]. == Gallery == === Artwork === Noah Mio Interlink.png|Noah's Ouroboros Ouroboros Mio.png|Mio's Ouroboros Taion Eunie Interlink.webp|Eunie's Ouroboros Ouroboros Taion.png|Taion's Ouroboros Lanz Sena Interlink.webp|Lanz's Ouroboros Ouroboros Sena.png|Sena's Ouroboros Ouroboros Fusion Artwork.jpg|Artwork of Noah and Mio Interlinking Noah Ouroboros Concept 1.png|Noah's Ouroboros Form Concept Art Noah Ouroboros Concept 2.png Noah Ouroboros Concept 3.png Noah Ouroboros Concept 4.png Mio Ouroboros Concept 1.png|Mio's Ouroboros Form Concept Art Mio Ouroboros Concept 2.png Mio Ouroboros Concept 3.png Mio Ouroboros Concept 4.png Eunie Ouroboros Concept 1.png|Eunie's Ouroboros Form Concept Art Eunie Ouroboros Concept 2.png Eunie Ouroboros Concept 3.png Eunie Ouroboros Concept 4.png Taion Ouroboros Concept 1.png|Taion's Ouroboros Form Concept Art Taion Ouroboros Concept 2.png Taion Ouroboros Concept 3.png Taion Ouroboros Concept 4.png Lanz Ouroboros Concept 1.png|Lanz's Ouroboros Form Concept Art Lanz Ouroboros Concept 2.png Lanz Ouroboros Concept 3.png Lanz Ouroboros Concept 4.png Sena Ouroboros Concept 1.png|Sena's Ouroboros Form Concept Art Sena Ouroboros Concept 2.png Sena Ouroboros Concept 3.png Sena Ouroboros Concept 4.png === Screenshots === Noah Mio Ouroboros fusion Screenshot.jpeg|Noah and Mio Interlinking CI NSwitch XenobladeChronicles3 Ouroboros 01.jpg|Three Ouroboros CI NSwitch XenobladeChronicles3 Ouroboros 02.jpg|An Ouroboros in battle The First Ouroboros Interlink.jpg| The First Ouroboros Interlink Ouroboros-Moebius Iris - Mio (Agnus).jpg|Ouroboros-Moebius Iris - Mio (Agnus) Ouroboros-Moebius Iris - Noah (Keves).jpg|Ouroboros-Moebius Iris - Noah (Keves) == References == {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Mechanics]] [[Category:XC3 Ouroboros]] [[Category:XC3 Playable Characters]] [[Category:XC3 Plot]] [[Category:XC3FR Plot]] [[Category:Pages needing plot info]]

{{Infobox quest |name = Ouroboros Fever |image = XC3 Challenge Battle Mode.png |description = "Pleasant challenge, this one. Can keep Ouroboros forms very long time. Long enough to enjoy to max!" |giver = [[Nopon Archsage]] |location = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |prereqs = Chapter 7 started |difficultyCB3 = 2 |rewards = 350-500 [[Noponstone]]s (Easy)
700-1000 [[Noponstone]]s (Normal)
1050-1500 [[Noponstone]]s (Hard) }} '''Ouroboros Fever''' is a Time Attack [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge Battle]] in {{XC3}}. It can be received from [[Nopon Archsage]] in the [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]], available as downloadable content from the second part of the Expansion Pass. Clearing this challenge with at least an A rank for the first time will unlock the Swimwear B outfit for [[Eunie]]. == Challenge Rules == {| class="xc1" | Waves || 4 |- | Level Restriction || Lv 60 |- | Other Rules || In this challenge, the heat gauge will build up slower while [[Interlink]]ed. |} == Enemies == {| class="xc1" ! Wave ! Enemy ! Level |- | rowspan="3" | 1 || [[Papillico Kapiba]] x3 || 60 |- | [[Curran Volff]] x3 || 60 |- | [[Avee Skwaror]] x2 || 60 |- | rowspan="3" | 2 || [[Landon Ropl]] x1 || 62 |- | [[Valt Ropl (XC3)|Valt Ropl]] x1 || 62 |- | [[Sarabashi Ropl (XC3)|Sarabashi Ropl]] x1 || 62 |- | 3 || [[Jarack Vvarga]] x 2|| 63 |- | 4 || [[Rabejan Darbus]] x 1|| 65 |} [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battles]]

{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Overfist Balroy |image = XC3 Overfist Balroy.png |caption = Overfist Balroy |type = [[Keves Forces]]
|tab1 = 1st |category = [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |level = 68 |area = [[Keves Castle]] ([[Throne Room (XC3)|Throne Room]]) |spawntime = During ''[[Fate]]'' |respawn = No |movement = |detection = |exp = |cp = |sp = |gold = |hp = |strength = |ether = |dexterity = |agility = |physdef = |ethdef = |critrate = |guardrate =
|tab2 = 2nd |category2 = [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |level2 = 69 |area2 = [[Keves Castle]] ([[Throne Room (XC3)|Throne Room]]) |spawntime2 = During ''[[Fate]]'' |respawn2 = No |movement2 = |detection2 = |exp2 = |cp2 = |sp2 = |gold2 = |hp2 = |strength2 = |ether2 = |dexterity2 = |agility2 = |physdef2 = |ethdef2 = |critrate2 = |guardrate2 = }} '''Overfist Balroy''' is a [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] who is part of the [[Keves Forces]] and is fought at level 68 and 69 in [[Keves Castle]] during ''[[Fate]]''.
==Story== He is one of the Four Divine Wings staging an armed uprising within the castle, alongside [[Incorruptible Sitre]], [[Mediator Adrinael]], and [[Puckish Lycconen]]. He was an ally of [[Zoren]] in the past, and has a certain fondness for and rivalry with him, who he refers to Zor, due to them being similar in enjoying the thrill of battle, but it is a mostly one-sided interest as Zoren does not care for Balroy whatsoever, and sees him as a slave to the instinct of combat. {{clr}}

[[File:Cruz Pagul.jpg|thumb|Pagul model]] '''Paguls''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|パグール}}, ''Pagūru'') are a family of shelled enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They are similar to hermit crabs, and resemble [[Krabble]]s and [[Krammit]]s. They are relatively rare, appear near water, and all have the same appearance.
== {{XC|-}} == Pagul are only found at [[Eryth Sea]] and on [[Valak Mountain]]. The horns of the Paguls at Eryth Sea shine brightly during the night. There are two types of Paguls, both involved in a [[Quest Enemy (XC1)|Quest]] objective.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Cruz Pagul]] * [[Sparas Pagul]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Proper Bandaz]]
== {{XCFC|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Cruz Pagul]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Clamouring Pagul]] (During ''[[Secure the Area]]'')
== {{XC2|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Dettl Pagul]] * [[Dockle Pagul]] * [[Genni Pagul]] * [[Grash Pagul]]
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Desert Pagul]] * [[Rebul Pagul]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Littlefort Morley]]
=== Quest Exclusive Boss === * [[Lavi Pagul]]
